required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combined PECS II and Transeversus Thoracic Plane Blocks Vs Serratus Anterior Plane Block in Modified Radical Mastectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Analgesic Efficacy of Combined Ultrasound-Guided PECS II and Transeversus Thoracic Plane Blocks Versus Ultrasound-Guided Serratus Anterior Plane Block in Modified Radical Mastectomy: A Prospective Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the analgesic efficacy of combined ultrasound (US)-guided pectoral nerve (PECS) block II and transversus thoracic plane (TTP) block versus US-guided serratus anterior plane (SAP) block in female patients undergoing modified radical mastectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: The total amount rescue analgesic consumption (morphine) in the first 24 hours postoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: Rescue analgesia in the form of morphine (3mg IV) will be given if the VAS is ≥ 40, repeated with lock out interval of 5 min guided with the occurrence of complications till the VAS is decreased to less than 40.

secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be assessed by Visual Analog scale (VAS) on admission to Post-Anesthesia Care unit (PACU) and at 30 minutes and then 1,2,4,6,12,18 and 24 hours postoperative. VAS (0-100; where 0 represents no pain and 100 represents the worst pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first rescue analgesia request.
secondary_outcome.description: Rescue analgesia in the form of morphine (3mg IV) will be given if the VAS is ≥ 40, repeated with lock out interval of 5 min guided with the occurrence of complications till the VAS is decreased to less than 40.

Additional boluses of fentanyl 0.5 µg /kg will be administered in case of inadequate analgesia that defined as increase of heart rate (HR) and /or mean arterial blood pressure (MAP) more than 20 % from baseline

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group I (pectoral nerve (PECS) block -transversus thoracic plane (TTP) block group)
arm_group.description: Patients will receive unilateral US-guided PECS II block and TTP block on the side of the operation after induction of general anesthesia.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group II (serratus anterior plane (SAP) block group)
arm_group.description: Patients will receive US-guided SAP block after induction of general anesthesia.

intervention.intervention_name: Pectoral nerve (PECS) block -transversus thoracic plane (TTP) block
intervention.description: Patients will receive unilateral US-guided PECS II block and TTP block on the side of the operation after induction of general anesthesia.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group I (pectoral nerve (PECS) block -transversus thoracic plane (TTP) block group)

intervention.description: Patients will receive US-guided SAP block after induction of general anesthesia.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group II (serratus anterior plane (SAP) block group)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients
- Aged 21-60 years
- ASA physical status I, II
- Scheduled for unilateral modified radical mastectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient refusal.
2. Known hypersensitivity to local anesthetics.
3. Body mass index > 35 kg /m2.
4. Uncooperative or psychiatric patients.
5. Infection at the injection site.
6. Coagulation disorder.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Resident at Anesthesiology, Surgical ICU and Pain medicine

patient_data.ipd_description: The data will be available upon reasonable request.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The data will be available upon reasonable request.
